intro: Perijea syncarpa, commonly known as the clustered spiny hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Perijea syncarpa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
